marketNews.title: Government Regulation No. 38/2025 Allows Central Government to Lend to Regional Governments, SOEs, and BUMDs
marketNews.content: The Indonesian government officially released Government Regulation No. 38/2025, which allows the central government to provide loans to regional governments, state-owned enterprises (BUMN), and regional-owned enterprises (BUMD) to support national development projects. The policy aims to provide cheaper financing for infrastructure projects and development programs at the provincial and regency levels. The loans will be funded from the state budget and must be approved by the parliament, and are only granted to borrowers with sound financial conditions. The central government will also impose penalties for late payments, as stipulated in the loan agreements. The regulation follows President Prabowo Subianto's decision to cut the intergovernmental transfer to regions in 2026 by 20% YoY to 693 trillion rupiah to make room for priority programs such as free nutritious meals and increased defense spending.

marketNews.title: IDX Index Evaluation Effective 3 Nov 2025 – 30 Jan 2026
marketNews.content: The Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) announced on Monday (27/10) the evaluation of the LQ45, IDX30, and IDX80 indices, effective from 3 November 2025 to 30 January 2026. Details: LQ45 – added: BUMI, DSSA, EMTK, HEAL, NCKL; removed: ARTO, BRIS, JSMR, MAPA, SMRA. IDX30 – added: AADI, PGEO; removed: AKRA, EXCL. IDX80 – added: BUMI, DSSA, KIJA, KPIG, PNBN, RATU, WIFI; removed: AUTO, BFIN, BNGA, BRIS, MNCN, SRTG, TKIM.

marketNews.title: OPEC+ Plans December 2025 Oil Production Increase
marketNews.content: OPEC+ announced plans to increase oil production by 137,000 barrels per day in December 2025 to regain market share. Previously, OPEC+ had raised its production target by a total of more than 2.7 million barrels per day – about 2.5% of global supply – roughly half of the total cut of 5.85 million barrels per day agreed by the group in previous years. The final decision on the December 2025 increase will be discussed by OPEC+ members at the meeting on Sunday (2/11).

marketNews.title: Amman Mineral International Receives Six-Month Copper Concentrate Export Permit
marketNews.content: The Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, announced on Tuesday (28/10) that the ministry has issued an export permit for copper concentrate for Amman Mineral International ($AMMN) for a period of about six months. The permit was granted after the AMMN copper smelter project in West Sumbawa, West Nusa Tenggara faced a kahar condition that hindered the commissioning process.

marketNews.title: Raja Plans New Mid-Stream Sub-Holding, Potential IPO of Subsidiary
marketNews.content: Raja (RAJA) CEO Djauhar Maulidi said the company plans to establish a new sub-holding in the mid-stream sector at the end of 2025. Currently, RAJA has three mid-stream subsidiaries: PT Triguna Internusa Pratama (infrastructure and utilities), PT Petrotech Penta Nusa (oil-and-gas support services), and PT Heksa Energi Mitraniaga (oil and gas storage). The CEO indicated that one of these subsidiaries may be taken public on the Indonesia Stock Exchange.

marketNews.title: SOLA Signs Strategic MOU with Polyroads for Road-Construction Materials
marketNews.content: Xolare RCR Energy (SOLA) signed a strategic cooperation memorandum of understanding with Polyroads Pty. Ltd., a South African road-construction material producer, to develop production and marketing. Polyroads products will be manufactured at SOLA’s Indonesian facilities and will be used for soil stabilization and sub-base layers on haulage roads. The partnership will also develop a marketing channel for SOLA’s asphalt membrane in Africa.

marketNews.title: Olive Group to Build Green Commercial Vehicle Ecosystem with Oscar Mitra
marketNews.content: Olive Group Chairman An Shaohong said the group plans to develop a green commercial vehicle ecosystem together with Oscar Mitra Sukses Sejahtera (OLIV), covering vehicle manufacturing, battery banks, and a digital platform. Previously, Olive’s shareholders Hendro Jap and Hieo Mie Tjen signed an agreement to sell 77.9% of OLIV to PT Olive Power Invest, PT Motif Investasi Indonesia, and PT Pacific Prima Permata. The agreement is now under regulator review.

marketNews.title: Atlas Resources Announces 8.5% Private Placement
marketNews.content: Atlas Resources (ARII) plans to conduct a private placement of up to 319 million new shares, representing roughly 8.5% of total issued and paid-in capital. The execution price and prospective investors have not been disclosed, and the proceeds will be used for working capital. The corporate action will be discussed at the extraordinary general meeting on 29 October 2025.

marketNews.content: Top Gainer – EM... (EMTK) +10.28%; MAPI +7.59%; MAPA +7.52%; BUMI +6.82%.

tickerNews.title: BMRI Net Profit 9M25 (-10% YoY) Aligns with Expectations, Signals 2026 Recovery
tickerNews.content: Bank Mandiri (BMRI) recorded net profit of IDR 13.3 trillion in 3Q25 (-14% YoY, +18% QoQ). The result brings 9M25 net profit to IDR 37.7 trillion (-10% YoY), matching 75% of the 2025 consensus estimate (vs. 9M24: 75% actual 2024). The decline is due to weak Pre-Provision Operating Profit (PPOP) caused by a surge in opex while Net Interest Income (NII) grew only low-single-digit, and a 22%/10% YoY rise in provision expenses in 3Q25/9M25. Management kept 2025 guidance for loan growth, NIM and Cost of Credit (CoC). For 2026, management indicated loan growth could be higher and aims to keep NIM stable despite lower CoF.

tickerNews.title: ANTM 9M25 Net Profit +171% YoY
tickerNews.content: Aneka Tambang (ANTM) posted net profit of IDR 1.28 trillion in 3Q25 (-50% QoQ, +96% YoY). The 9M25 net profit reached IDR 5.97 trillion (+171% YoY), equal to 81% of the 2025 consensus estimate. The 'precious metals and refining' segment posted PAT of IDR 701 billion in 3Q25 (-54% QoQ, -33% YoY) with sales volume of 4.9 ton (vs. 2Q25: 15.6 ton, 3Q24: 12.6 ton). The segment’s PAT grew +89% YoY in 9M25 (vs. 1H25: +211% YoY), supported by a 20% YoY increase in sales volume to 34.2 ton (vs. 1H25: 29.3 ton). The 'nickel' segment posted PAT of IDR 1.35 trillion in 3Q25 (-39% QoQ, +311% YoY) with 3 million wmt nickel ore and 2,419 ton ferronickel (+162% QoQ, -50% YoY). 9M25 PAT for nickel rose to IDR 4.9 trillion (vs. 9M24: IDR 476 billion) with nickel ore volume up 97% YoY to 11.2 million wmt and ferronikel 8,182 ton (-30% YoY).

tickerNews.title: PANI Marketing Sales 3Q25 and 9M25
tickerNews.content: Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua (PANI) recorded marketing sales of IDR 1.98 trillion in 3Q25 (+43% YoY, +183% QoQ), resulting in 9M25 marketing sales of about IDR 3.15 trillion (-33% YoY). PANI also cut its 2025 marketing-sales target from roughly IDR 5.3 trillion to about IDR 4.3 trillion, meaning 9M25 performance is about 73% of the revised target. The company also disclosed that Bangun Kosambi Sukses (CBDK) posted marketing sales of IDR 27 billion in 3Q25 (-94% YoY, -52% QoQ), giving a 9M25 total of IDR 321 billion (-80% YoY). CBDK revised its 2025 marketing-sales target down to IDR 508 billion, equating to roughly 63% of the new target.

tickerNews.title: BTPS 3Q25 Net Profit Beats 75% Consensus
tickerNews.content: Bank BTPN Syariah (BTPS) posted net profit of IDR 302 billion in 3Q25 (+38% YoY, -9% QoQ). The 9M25 net profit reached IDR 946 billion (+23% YoY), matching 75% of the 2025 consensus estimate (vs. 9M24: 73% realisation). Profit was supported by a 45% YoY decline in provision expenses, although PPOP contracted –8% YoY –12% YoY. Management kept financing growth flat in 3Q25 and expects it to stay flat in 4Q25, with a potential rise in 2026.

tickerNews.title: MIKA 3Q25 Net Profit Higher Than Forecast
tickerNews.content: Mitra Keluarga Karyasehat (MIKA) posted net profit of IDR 377 billion in 3Q25 (+39% YoY, +15% QoQ). The 9M25 net profit reached IDR 1.00 trillion (+17% YoY), surpassing the 79% consensus estimate (vs. 2-year average 75.5% actual). Operating revenue grew 22% YoY to IDR 1.4 trillion (+10% QoQ). Operating margin rose to 33.6% (3Q24: 29.5%; 2Q25: 32.1%), driving a 38% YoY and 15% QoQ increase in operating profit.

tickerNews.title: AUTO 3Q25 Net Profit Up 22% YoY
tickerNews.content: Astra Otoparts (AUTO) posted net profit of IDR 630 billion in 3Q25 (+22% YoY, +45% QoQ). The 9M25 net profit reached IDR 1.57 trillion (+3% YoY), equal to 75% of the 2025 consensus (vs. 9M24: 75% actual). The profit increase was driven by a 6.8% operating-margin expansion to 6.1% (3Q24: 6.1%) and a 16% YoY rise in earnings from associated entities and joint ventures. tickerNews.content: Blue Blue Bird (BIRD) reported a net profit of IDR 147 billion in 3Q25 (-15% YoY, -13% QoQ). The 3Q25 profit decline stemmed from higher cost of goods sold and operating expenses that rose faster than revenue. Cost of goods sold rose 13% YoY/11% QoQ, while OPEX increased 13% YoY/9% QoQ.
